result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Norbert MALCHEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentence presently being served in Kewaunee County.

superMiscConds.notes: $4,597.26 to Broadwind Towers; $3,289.00 to James Marquardt; $2,511.99 to Jerome Rabitz; $300.00 to Stetson McCulley;  $250.00 to Mark McCulley;  $50.00 to Trevor McCulley; $353.00 to Craig Behnke;  $150.00 to Karen Kratz; $100.00 to Doug Nutt

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-28-14 at 4:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 05-22-14 at 2:00 p.m.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-26-14 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
RE:  James Marquardt, on 01-24-14.
Affidavit of Detective James Michel, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 5 counts burglary.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with Broadwind Towers.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.

Return of Search Warrant.  At 1:27 p.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.
